abilities.name: Aggressive
abilities.description: As a bonus Action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a Hostile creature that it can see.

abilities.name: Amphibious
abilities.description: The dragon can breathe air and water.

abilities.name: Multiattack
abilities.description: The dragon can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws

abilities.name: Legendary Resistance (3/day)
abilities.description: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead

abilities.name: Acid Breath (Recharge 5-6)
abilities.description: The dragon exhales acid in a 90-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 22 Dexterity saving throw, taking 67 (15d8) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one

abilities.name: Frightful Presence
abilities.description: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours

legendaryMechanics.legendaryDescription: The dragon can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The dragon regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn

legendaryActions.name: Detect
legendaryActions.description: The dragon makes a Wisdom (Perception) check

legendaryActions.name: Tail Attack
legendaryActions.description: The dragon makes a tail attack

legendaryActions.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendaryActions.description: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 15 ft. of the dragon must succeed on a DC 23 Dexterity saving throw or take 15 (2d6 + 8) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed
